paper.title: Optimising aerial military medical evacuation dispatching decisions via operations research techniques
paper.abstract: Senior military leaders and medical practitioners continuously seek new ways to improve the performance and organisation of deployed medical evacuation (MEDEVAC) systems to minimise mortality rates of combat casualties. The objective of this paper is to highlight how recent research in the fields of operations research and machine learning can be leveraged to better inform the implementation and modification of current and future MEDEVAC tactics, techniques and procedures for combat operations in a deployed environment. More specifically, this paper discusses state-of-the-art techniques that optimise the management of MEDEVAC assets prior to and during combat operations. These recent research efforts emphasise that military healthcare administrators should contribute to and extend the evolving portfolio of research that seeks to design and develop decision support systems leveraging artificial intelligence and operations research to improve MEDEVAC system performance.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要讨论如何利用运筹学和机器学习优化军事医疗后送（MEDEVAC）系统的调度决策，以提高战斗伤亡的生存率。其核心技术和应用场景与金融领域无关，特别是衍生品定价、金融风险管理和投资组合管理。
